Authors:
Janaine Rossane Araujo Silva, Lourdes Regina Lopes Batista,
Jaqueline Figueredo de Oliveira Costa, Mayra Machado de Medeiros Ferro,
Gaus Silvestre Andrade Lima, Iraildes Pereira Assuncao
Title:
Species of the Colletotrichum gloeosporioides complex
associated with anthracnose of pomegranate in Brazil
Keywords:
Punica granatum, multilocus phylogeny, genus
Colletotrichum.
Abstract:
Pomegranate is a fruit rich in vitamins and secondary
metabolites used in traditional medicine and industry. Still, prodution
losses can be associated with the anthracnose disease, caused by the
genus Colletotrichum. The present study had the objective to investigate
which Colletotricum species are responsible for anthracnose disease in
pomegranate in the northeastern Brazilian region, by using multilocus
phylogeny approach and morpho-cultural characteristics. Ten pathogenic
strains were obtained from symptomatic pomegranate fruits from the
states of Alagoas, Pernambuco and Bahia. The total DNA extracted was
amplified with GAPDH, Î²-TUB, CAL, ACT genes and the ITS-rDNA region. The
sequences obtained were used to construct Bayesian inference
phylogenetic trees. Mycelial growth rate, size and form of conidia and
appressories were evaluated for morpho-cultural characterization, in two
strains from each species identified by the molecular analyses. In the
present study four species from the complex Colletotrichum
gloeosporioides were identified: Colletotrichum tropicale, C. siamense,
C. fructicola and C. theobromicola. This is the first report for all
four species on pomegranate fruits in the world.
